title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:54 <jstoldt> could anyone tell me if the current 2.7.1 release is going to be final final? because it's still not on the news blog...  
08:59 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <vmassol> has quit  
09:07 <lpereira> has quit  
09:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <gsauthier> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <gsauthier> hi all  
09:19 <gsauthier> I have issues with the Blog Application  
09:19 <@cjdelisle> Hello, what's happening?  
09:19 <gsauthier> I'm working on the www.ow2.org web site, I opened a new Space and I would like to have a new Blog just on this space  
09:20 <gsauthier> i tried the Blog/Management page for creating the blog inside an existing space, but it didn't work  
09:21 <gsauthier> hmm, let me find the error I have ...  
09:21 <@cjdelisle> If you could paste it in a pastebin and give us the link, that'd be most helpful.  
09:21 <gsauthier> sure  
09:22 <gsauthier> but in fact, I din't have any error at all, the blog is just not created :(-  
09:22 <gsauthier> I don't see it in the existing blog section  
09:23 <gsauthier> don't know if this page is open to everyone but anyway ... http://www.ow2.org/view/Blog/Management  
09:23 <gsauthier> I just tried to create a blog in space Sandbox with name Wooot  
09:24 <gsauthier> then I cliked on create  
09:24 <gsauthier> ... a page blink ... :)  
09:24 <gsauthier> and I see the same page, with no references to the blog that should have been created  
09:24 <@cjdelisle> Unfortunately I'm not an expert on the blog application, if you wait until sdumitriu shows up he might know what is happening.  
09:25 <gsauthier> ok  
09:25 <gsauthier> thanks for listening :)  
09:25 <@cjdelisle> hehe sorry I couldn't be more help.  
09:29 <jstoldt> there is no other way to rollback the version of an attachment but to download and reattach and older revision, right?  
09:29 <@cjdelisle> correct.  
09:30 <jstoldt> thanks :)  
09:30 <gsauthier> Another question, looking at the code of the Blog/Management page, I see the usage of request.sendRedirection method  
09:30 <gsauthier> this is alos used in blog.CreatePost  
09:31 <gsauthier> and both are not working on the ow2 web site  
09:32 <@cjdelisle> That sounds like an issue with the reverse proxy. sendRedirect sends a Location header which perhaps the front end is stripping?  
09:32 <gsauthier> this is always the same logic:  
09:32 <gsauthier> 1. if title request parameter is set, then it really creates a new page using sendRedirection()  
09:32 <gsauthier> 2. if not set, just display the creation form  
09:32 <gsauthier> Ahhh, I'm no expert on theses apache stuff, but I know that we have some kind of URL rewrite  
09:32 <gsauthier> can this be the cause of the problems I see ?  
09:33 <@cjdelisle> Again I'm no expert on that code but it is entirely possible.  
09:33 <gsauthier> you see ? http://www.ow2.org/Sandbox/ /xwiki/bin/xxx/ has been ripped off  
09:34 <gsauthier> Ok, i'll talk with our webmaster and see if he understand that better than me :)  
09:34 <gsauthier> Thanks again  
09:37 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <tcamberlin> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <tcamberlin1> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <tcamberlin> has quit  
10:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <jstoldt> colleague just got some weirdness  
10:27 <jstoldt> he tried adding some .bmp (for whatever insane reason) and turns out the WYSIWYG editor attached some broken .png in addition to the .bmp, put in image:\*.png in the code instead of image:\*bmp  
10:27 <jstoldt> XWiki Enterprise 2.7-SNAPSHOT.34766 << that's the version  
10:27 <jstoldt> any ideas on that?  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> I don't think web browsers support .bmp  
10:29 <jstoldt> oh, IE just might... but what i wonder about, is there supposed to be some conversion going on?  
10:29 <jstoldt> that accounts for this weirdness  
10:29 <jstoldt> and is possibly broken  
10:30 <@cjdelisle> I don't think so. I suspect it just tacked .png on the end of the name because it thought it should be an image but couldn't figure out what  
10:30 <jstoldt> but why were broken .png attachments created?  
10:31 <@cjdelisle> Try downloading the .png file, rename .bmp and see if it's your image.  
10:31 <jstoldt> ah, good idea  
10:32 <jstoldt> hmmm doubt it  
10:32 <jstoldt> downloading them with Opera suggests they are zero filled  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> sounds like a bug  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> Did you upload it with wysiwyg?  
10:33 <jstoldt> yay me for creating more work for you, yet again  
10:33 <jstoldt> he did...  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> Are you absolutely sure it is not the same file with a different name?  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> Is it the same size?  
10:33 <jstoldt> i think you misunderstand me  
10:34 <jstoldt> he uploaded say, dna.bmp via the wysiwyg add image panel  
10:34 <jstoldt> dna.bmp and dna.png appeared as attachments  
10:34 <jstoldt> dna.bmp working, dna.png broken and zero filled  
10:35 <jstoldt> in the wiki code it said image:dna.png instead of image:dna.bmp  
10:36 <@cjdelisle> that's interesting.  
10:36 <@cjdelisle> Sounds like a wysiwyg bug  
10:36 <jstoldt> it is, isn't it?! ;)  
10:36 <jstoldt> yeah, figure so  
10:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <jstoldt> okay, nice follow up  
10:57 <jstoldt> this might entirely be a IE 7 problem  
10:58 <@cjdelisle> IE7 has problems?  
10:58 <jstoldt> because when the colleague tried using IE7 to view a file on a page that had "für" in the name (so a non ASCII char) it broke  
10:58 <jstoldt> he couldn't view the image  
10:58 <jstoldt> but using opera it worked flawlessly  
10:58 <jstoldt> i checked the url  
10:59 <jstoldt> and while opera used unescaped 'ü', IE used some %BC kind of stuff  
11:00 <jstoldt> so this is prolly where the entire breakage began  
11:00 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
11:00 <jstoldt> so question for me, why does the URL change in both browsers, although it does work if i use ü in the name... and why can IE7 view the page but not the attachment?  
11:01 <jstoldt> i reckon there is some different way to process the URL when used for page rather than attachment  
11:01 <jstoldt> anyway, g2g for a while

13:19 <jstoldt> thanks, though  
13:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: Ping  
13:50 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: any idea when M3 will be out ?  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> Next week  
13:50 <+sburjan`> so I guess I should start testing  
14:05 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: pong  
14:05 <@sdumitriu> Who wrote the activitystream plugin?  
14:05 <@sdumitriu> I see that you committed it, did you also write it?  
14:05 <+jvelociter> I think it's Ludovic and Marius  
14:06 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Ping  
14:06 <+jvelociter> but I'm not sure about Marius, maybe it was Cristie  
14:07 <@sdumitriu> I'm trying to make a component on top of it, and I want to make sure I use the fields in the right way  
14:07 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I think I started it yes, based on some code from Ludovic  
14:07 <+mflorea> but it was long ago :) so I don't remember much, I'd have to look over the code  
14:09 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what do you want to know?  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> Does this description look right:  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/ev  
14:17 <@sdumitriu> Don't spend too much time on it, if something doesn't spring to mind as wrong, then it's OK.  
14:19 <+mflorea> the only thing that is missing is param1-5 :) so it seems we though that events can have parameters  
14:19 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but I don't like them very much  
14:19 <@sdumitriu> I think it would be better to create typed values for them  
14:19 <@sdumitriu> For example param1 currently stores the title of the document, so I replaced it with getDocumentTitle  
14:20 <@sdumitriu> And param2 is used by the new events to store the related target, thus param2->getRelatedEntity  
14:20 <+mflorea> I see, then maybe a field where events can store "data"  
14:20 <@sdumitriu> Isn't the body enough?  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> Note that the current implementation is just a wrapper on top of the activitystream plugin, so the underlying structure is the same, I just renamed some methods  
14:22 <+mflorea> I see that body is a string right now, I'm thinking of a field to store an object, but then we can have problems serializing it  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +    /\*\*  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +     \* A larger section of text where the event can store some data.  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +     \*  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +     \* @return the body of the event  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +     \*/  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> +    String getBody();  
14:23 <+mflorea> sounds good then, apps will take care of serializing and deserializing the data from the body field  
15:21 <abusenius> has quit  
15:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <abusenius> has quit  
15:43 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: i'm looking at XWikiHibernate#searchDocuments and i think there is an important issue in multiwiki and I would like you to confirm if you have some time:  
15:44 <+tmortagne> this method is executing a query first to find documents names  
15:44 <+tmortagne> then for each name it's doing a getDocument  
15:45 <+tmortagne> but it's possible to call this method with checkRight=true to tel it to check right of current user for each document  
15:45 <@sdumitriu> Which method?  
15:45 <+tmortagne> to return only the document on which current user has the right  
15:45 <+tmortagne> XWikiHibernate#searchDocuments  
15:45 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <@sdumitriu> There's no such class  
15:45 <+tmortagne> they all call each other  
15:45 <+tmortagne> the full one is searchDocuments(String wheresql, boolean distinctbylanguage, boolean customMapping,  
15:45 <+tmortagne>         boolean checkRight, int nb, int start, List< ? > parameterValues, XWikiContext context)  
15:45 <@sdumitriu> I'm looking at     private List<DocumentReference> searchDocumentReferencesInternal(String sql, int nb, int start,  
15:45 <@sdumitriu>         List parameterValues, XWikiContext context) throws XWikiException  
15:46 <+tmortagne> XWikiHibernateStore sorry  
15:46 <+tmortagne> not refererence  
15:46 <+tmortagne> the document one  
15:46 <Denis> has quit  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> Ah, that one  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> Didn't even know it's used  
15:47 <+tmortagne> well it is :)  
15:48 <@sdumitriu> OK, so what's the problem?  
15:48 <+tmortagne> the proble is that checkAccess needs to go to main wiki to check wiki owner, PR and things like that  
15:48 <@sdumitriu> Right  
15:48 <+tmortagne> but sine it's in a session already impossible to switch wiki for it  
15:49 <@sdumitriu> The transaction should be ended well before checking rights  
15:49 <@sdumitriu> Right?  
15:49 <+tmortagne> yep it should get all the names and then do the right check and getdocument  
15:49 <@sdumitriu> +1  
15:50 <+tmortagne> basically use the getdocumentreferences one which would be nicer anyway  
15:50 <+tmortagne> s/getdocumentreferences/searchDocumentReferencesInternal/  
15:51 <jstoldt> see you  
15:51 <+tmortagne> ok taking care of it, hope that's all behind http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAWM-136  
15:54 <jstoldt> has quit  
15:54 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
15:55 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> !news

17:35 <+sburjan`> tmortagne: did you commit XAWM-133 on 2.7 branch too ?  
17:35 <lucaa> has quit  
17:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan`: XAWM-133 is an application  
17:36 <+tmortagne> will we in 2.7.x if it's released with XE 2.7.x  
17:36 <+sburjan`> I know, but it will be included in 2.7.2 ? (the fix)  
17:37 <+sburjan`> ok, thanks  
17:37 <+tmortagne> no idea, i'm not the release manager ;)  
17:37 <+tmortagne> not that XAWM-133 is cased by velocity upgrade  
17:37 <+tmortagne> so it should not fail in 2.7  
17:37 <+sburjan`> I only wanted to know if there would be a \_future\_ 2.7.2 if this fix will be included  
17:37 <+tmortagne> s/cased/caused/

19:11 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I have a difficult issue XWIKI-6029 . The wiki name is not part of the GWT-RPC service URL in path-based XEM. The only solution I have is to pass the wiki name to all the GWT-RPC services that need it, but it's ugly.. I'm looking for a better solution. I though of forcing the editor code to load through the skin action: /xwiki/wiki/test/skin/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/xwe.nocache.js but it's worse and then the action servlet collides with the
